solution_line_template: Each car in the garage has {wheels_per_car} wheels, for a total of {wheels_per_car}*{num_cars}=<<{wheels_per_car}*{num_cars}={car_wheels}>>{car_wheels} wheels.
The riding lawnmower has {lawnmower_wheels} wheels, bringing the total up to {car_wheels}+{lawnmower_wheels}={total_after_lawnmower} wheels.

The bicycles have {wheels_per_bike} wheels each and there are {num_bikes} of them, for {num_bikes}*{wheels_per_bike}={bike_wheels} wheels, bringing the total to {total_after_lawnmower}+{bike_wheels}= {total_after_bikes}.
The tricycle has {tricycle_wheels} wheels, and the unicycle has {unicycle_wheels} wheel, bringing the total up to {total_after_bikes}+{unicycle_wheels}+{tricycle_wheels}= {total_wheels} wheels
